function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Connectivity of medical tools and devices through the internet","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accurate forecasting of virus","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Iot devices and healthcare networks can be vulnerable to cyber attacks, leading to unauthorized access and manipulation of critical medical data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on real-time data and smart device connectivity may lead to errors and misinformation in disease tracking and patient diagnosis.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential over-reliance on iot technology may lead to complacency and reduced human oversight in healthcare decision-making.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Security and privacy concerns related to the data received from iot devices in healthcare","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration and network protocol challenges in connecting iot devices for covid-19 management","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data storage and management challenges for the massive amount of data generated by iot devices in healthcare","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of iot for covid-19 tracing and monitoring","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of smartphone applications for covid-19 tracking","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global deployment of covid-19 tracking apps","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential privacy and security risks associated with monitoring and tracking of infected individuals’ data through iot","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on iot technology may lead to neglect of essential non-technological intervention measures","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate and organized facilities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underutilization of ioht/iomt","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for the transmission of contagious diseases through interconnected devices and networks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective surveillance systems for infectious disease outbreaks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in implementing wbe for infectious disease surveillance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of analytical tools for cost-effective, sensitive, and selective analysis of biomarker groups","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sampling from smaller subgroups leading to stigmatization","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in outbreak handling between developing and developed countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex relationship between antibiotic concentrations and resistance in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seasonal variations in antibiotic resistance genes args in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prevalence of antimicrobial resistance genes args in influent wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of population-scale epidemiological information for amr surveillance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlations between antibiotic levels and abundance of args in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs like tamiflu and relenza are stockpiled globally and deployed during pandemics, leading to high proportions of communities taking the drugs in a short time window, resulting in the drugs and their metabolites being present in wastewater.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs, if present in low levels in the environment, could cause irreversible effects to viral genomes, leading to resistance.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolized forms in wastewater streams contribute to environmental contamination and potential long-term impacts on microbial resistance.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of antibiotic consumption in the community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on antibiotic metabolites in wastewater analysis","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear impact of antibiotic usage on bacterial communities in wwtps","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of proteins in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of investigation into stability of proteins in sewage systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unmonitored antimicrobial usage within a community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate utilization of urine proteomics for disease biomarkers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited integration of urinary biomarkers in wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in assessing polio through sewage samples","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in efficiency of dna/rna extraction from pcr inhibitor rich samples","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the suitability of dpcr for certain sample types","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wastewater to detect pathogenic organisms may lead to misinterpretation of disease prevalence in the community.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High mutation rates of rna viruses may lead to rapid adaptation and spread in new host populations.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical data from wastewater surveillance may not accurately predict future disease outbreaks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sewage system containing complex microbial communities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of water fingerprinting for community-wide infectious disease diagnostics","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wide array of endogenous chemical and biological urinary biomarkers linked with disease","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater-based epidemiology wbe techniques for biomarker selection","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulties in estimating population size of individual wwtp catchments","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties associated with sample collection and analytical variability","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible transmission of contagious diseases through wastewater and surface water","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
